content.div:
Addiction makes people do terrible, awful, very bad things -- things like leaking fuzzy snippets of unreleased Madonna songs. We just never knew it was possible to have a chemical dependence on MDNA.

Perez Hilton posted a one-minute sample of previously unheard Madonna track "I'm Addicted" online today, a cut off the pop queen's upcoming March 26 release, MDNA. And as the site boasts, they'll "be leaking songs from it leading up to MDNA's release."

With four decades of superstardom to her credit, at least Madonna saw such new-fangled shenanigans coming. As she told UK chat show host Graham Norton in December, MDNA's release date is ultimately to be determined by the resourcefulness of online goons. "It depends how quickly people hack into my server and leak it," she told Norton. "People can't wait? It's terrible."

Now, now, Madge. So long as people like the (fuzzy and slight) pirated snippets they hear, no harm done.

As such, we'll leave "I'm Addicted" to you. How does it fare compared to MDNA's chirpy lead single, "Give Me All Your Luvin'?"

Like that aforementioned Nicki Minaj and M.I.A.-featuring track -- and many a Madonna song before that one -- "I'm Addicted," reportedly produced by Madonna, The Demolition Crew and Benny and Ale Benassi, was crafted with the dancefloor in mind.

Listen to a preview of "I'm Addicted" below:

MDNA's deluxe edition tracklisting:

1. Girls Gone Wild

2. Gang Bang

3. I'm Addicted

4. Some Girls

5. I Don't Give A

6. Turn Up the Radio

7. Give Me All Your Luvin'

8. B-day Song

9. Superstar

10. I'm a Sinner

11. Masterpiece

12. Falling Free

13. Love Spent

14. I F---ed Up

15. Beautiful Killer

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj released new song "Stupid Hoe" today. The lyrics would seem to confirm that she'll appear at the Super Bowl with Madonna (and also that she thinks someone is a "stupid hoe").
